Factorize the quadratic equation. It becomes (x - 2)(x - 2) = 0. Do you understand this step? (Yes/No/Explain More)

history.message: Solve x^2 - 4x + 4 = 0.
Factorize the quadratic equation. It becomes (x - 2)(x - 2) = 0. Do you understand this step? (Yes/No/Explain More)

response: Sure! x^2 - 4x + 4 is a perfect square trinomial. It simplifies to (x - 2)^2 = 0. This means x - 2 = 0, so x = 2. Does that help? (Yes/No)
